description: Dive into "Beaches of Bliss: Discover Kata's Coastal Gems" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Beaches of Bliss: Discover Kata's Coastal Gems

places.generalDescription: Karon Beach is a stunning 4-kilometer stretch of golden sand and crystal-clear waters, making it an ideal destination for couples and families seeking a more tranquil experience compared to the bustling Patong Beach, just 15 minutes away. This picturesque beach offers calm swimming conditions on serene days, while adventurous souls can enjoy the thrill of larger waves when the winds pick up.

sources.snippet: A favourite of many who come to Phuket, Karon Beach isn‚Äôt quite as popular as Patong, but there‚Äôs still plenty to do other than sunbathe here. The rocky area around the south of the beach is a top spot for snorkelling, but for those who prefer a more high-octane activity, it‚Äôs possible to rent jet skis on the beach too. Whilst the sand might not be as soft as some beaches, the length of the beach means you won‚Äôt be short on space.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Phuket, Thailand

sources.snippet: Next up is Karon Beach, a 4-km long golden sand beach, the third-largest on the island with stunningly clear water, sands that are soft to the touch, and plenty of space for you to enjoy a nice, quiet, peaceful vacation. Karon Beach may not be as calm and peaceful as Nai Harn Beach, but it is much larger, which makes it feel almost as calm. At Karon Beach, you will also have easy access to other tourist attractions as well, like the Big Buddha and the beautiful Karon Viewpoint, where you will be able to see Karon, Kata, and Kamala beaches perfectly lined up from above.
sources.shortName: Phuket‚Äôs Prettiest Beaches: My Top 8 Picks

sources.snippet: One very unique feature of Karon Beach is the squeakiness of the sand ‚Äì you can literally hear it make funny sounds as you walk on it!. But the fine, soft sand isn‚Äôt the only thing that makes Karon one ofPhuket‚Äôs best beaches. Most of the southern end of the beach features a line of trees with rich foliage, while the northern end features volleyball nets for those who‚Äôd like to work up some sweat before taking a cool dip in the sea which is approachable, except in the low season.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Phuket within a Drive

sources.snippet: Karon Beach is a three-kilometer stretch of white sandy coastline making it one of the longest Phuket beaches. It‚Äôs known for its quiet atmosphere and sunsets, and as you head further north, the beach becomes even more spacious and peaceful. During our two-week stay in Karon, we went to Karon Beach for a quick dip, dined in local restaurants nearby, watched the sunsets, and simply enjoyed a nice evening walk almost every day.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Phuket Beaches You'll Love in 2025

sources.snippet: A ribbon of sand blessed with clean turquoise shallows, Karon Beach‚Äîdespite the neat rows of development behind it‚Äînever feels crowded. There‚Äôs always a sun lounger to rent or an island of sand for your towel, book, and cold drink (even more so at the beach‚Äôs northern end). Settle in and be lulled by the view of picturesque tropical islets dotting the calm blue of the Andaman Sea.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in Phuket

sources.snippet: With its almost 3.5 km in length, Karon Beach is the second-longest beach of Phuket. It‚Äôs an immense of whistling white sandy beach with incredibly clear waters in high season and beautifully lined with coconut trees, making it one of the most beautiful beaches in Phuket. The beach is surprisingly vast that it never feels crowded even during the high season.
sources.shortName: ‚ñ∑ 20 Most Beautiful Beaches in Phuket üå¥

sources.snippet: Wedged between Patong (to the north) and Kata (to the south), it's the third longest beach on the island and one of the most popular. Karon beach boasts the typical soft, golden sand made famous by this region, and sea so turquoise it screams "holiday.". Much quieter than its sandy neighbors, this beach offers visitors a quieter, more laid-back experience.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Phuket | PlanetWare

sources.snippet: The next beach I saw on my journey south was Karon beach and seeing it from the hill was way better than seeing it from the beach itself. Because I was walking towards it, I found this amazing spot with a clear view of Karon beach, and the best viewpoint from the street. Near Centara Villas is where you will find this gorgeous view of Karon beach
sources.shortName: Discovering the most beautiful Phuket beaches

sources.snippet: Karon Beach is just over the hill from Patong Beach, but it seems like a world away. In the summer months, Karon Beach and neighbouring Kata Beach serve as the centre of the surfing scene in Phuket. At other times of the year, Karon Beach offers beautiful natural solitude and is the perfect place to enjoy a quiet walk on the beach.
sources.shortName: The Must-Visit Beaches in Phuket You Can‚Äôt Miss

sources.snippet: Karon Beach is the second-longest beach in Phuket and one of the most popular. The beach is an impressive stretch of white sand and clear blue water in high season, so vast that it never feels crowded. There are many good hotels across the main beach road, but Centara Grand Beach Resort is the only one with real beach access.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Phuket Beaches ‚õ±Ô∏è

sources.snippet: Image Credit:  HutheMeow, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons. Wedged between Kata Beach to the south and Patong Beach to the north, Karon Beach boasts silky golden sand that gives a luxurious feel to your soles. Magnifying its beauty is the white froth and the vast expanse of the turquoise-blue waters of the Andaman Sea.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Very Best Beaches in Phuket

sources.snippet: Karon Beach is one of the longest of Phuket‚Äôs best beaches; I think only Mai Khao Beach and Bang Tao Beach are longer. Although there are some huge hotels along the beach road in Karon, this is not a problem. The hotels are on the opposite side of the road, so they can‚Äôt block access to the beach.
sources.shortName: Full list of Phuket's best beaches, find them here

sources.snippet: It is another very beautiful Phuket beach because there is turquoise sea water and soft sand texture comfortable to walk. It is a quiet beach suitable for relaxing on a beach or sunbathe without anyone bothering. Also, it has strong wind waves suitable for surfing activities as well.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Phuket

sources.snippet: Karon Beach is much larger than Kata Beach and offers plenty of space to spread out and relax. The sand is soft and white, and the water is perfect for swimming. If you're hoping to do some snorkelling, head to the northern end of the beach where you'll find a small reef.
sources.shortName: 5 Best quiet Beaches in Phuket | Blog ¬ª

sources.snippet: The beach is long, the sand is fine, and there are hotel options to suit everyone - 5 star to fan rooms in guesthouses... The beach area has been revamped over the last few years, and every time I hit Karon after coming from Patong I think "wow, this is nice".
sources.shortName: Phuket Beaches - Yes, we have a lot of Beaches!

sources.snippet:
Karon is my personal pick of all Phuket Beaches and is the second largest tourist beach in Phuket. Here you will find a few
large resorts and hotels and a variety of activities, restaurants and
shopping. See why Karon Beach is so popular.
sources.shortName: Phuket Beaches | Guide to the Best Beaches in Phuket.

sources.snippet: Karon Beach, one of the best beaches in Phuket, is divided into Karon Noi and Karon Yai. Karon Beach is the first main beach south of Patong, and is one of the longest beaches in Phuket. The area is extremely popular with tourists.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Phuket, Thailand: 15 Most Beautiful Beaches

sources.snippet: Karon Beach is a straight beach and there is a little crowd during the season. The beach is a moderate one compared to Patong. There are good Thai food restaurants in the vicinity.
sources.shortName: 11 Most Popular Beaches in Phuket for Families

places.name: Karon Beach

reviews.text: Clean water and sands. Less crowded than any beach you may wish to visit in Phuket. Few food stalls and activities.  The beach is huge and the waves are beautiful.
The sand here are soft and feel great. But the waves could be scary if you come at raining season. Sunset view is nice.

Nice beach to take the family out. The sunset is amazing here.

Lots of water sports activities are available here and across the beach there good spaces for parking the motorbike and lots of bars and restaurants to chillout and see the sunset.

places.generalDescription: Nestled between the serene Ya Nui and Nai Harn beaches, Windmill Viewpoint is a hidden gem that offers breathtaking views of the Andaman Sea. This charming spot is perfect for those seeking a peaceful sunset experience away from the crowds typically found at Promthep Cape. The iconic white windmill serves as a picturesque backdrop, making it an ideal location for photography enthusiasts. While you can visit any time of day, arriving during dusk rewards you with one of Phuket's most stunning sunsets.

sources.snippet: From Windmill‚Äôs viewpoint, you will see Yanui Beach from a different perspective and you can also see Nai Harn Beach getting closer. The views are stunning and this is definitely a must-visit.
sources.shortName: Discovering the most beautiful Phuket beaches

places.name: Windmill Viewpoint

reviews.text:
Windmill Viewpoint, situated between Nai Harn and Ya Nui beaches in southern Phuket, Thailand, offers panoramic vistas of the Andaman Sea and the surrounding coastline.

From this vantage point, visitors can enjoy sweeping views of Ya Nui Beach to the south, Nai Harn Beach to the north, and the nearby Koh Man island.

Unobstructed sunset views, making it a best spot for photographers and couples seeking a romantic backdrop.  The viewpoint is accessible by car or motorbike, with a small parking area available.

In summary, Windmill Viewpoint offers a tranquil setting to take in Phuket's coastal scenery, especially during sunset, and is a worthwhile stop for those exploring the island's southern region.

Moody Skies, Magical Views ‚Äì Windmill Viewpoint in the Rain

Visited Windmill Viewpoint on a slightly rainy day, and honestly, it turned out to be one of the most peaceful and beautiful moments of my trip.

Even with the overcast skies and gentle drizzle, the view was absolutely stunning. The clouds rolling over the lush green hills, the ocean shimmering in muted silver tones, and the soft breeze made the whole scene feel like a dream. There's something so calming and cinematic about standing up there in the rain, watching nature do its thing.

The spot itself is easy to reach and not too crowded (especially when the weather isn't sunny ‚Äì lucky me!). There's a quiet energy to the place, and the windmill adds a charming touch to the landscape.

If you're in Phuket and thinking of skipping this viewpoint just because it's not all sunshine and blue skies ‚Äì don't. The rain brings its own magic, and Windmill Viewpoint wears it beautifully.

Stunning view of Ya Nui and Nai Han beach. There is small building area that keep you from the sun. The way up to view point is quite steep but easy to drive up.
Small car park , around 10 cars.

places.address: Q894+VG9, Rawai, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Yanui Beach, located on the west coast of Phuket just south of Nai Harn, is a small and secluded sandy beach surrounded by trees. Despite its unassuming appearance, it offers a serene atmosphere for activities like snorkeling and kayaking, especially during sunset. The beach is known for its clear waters and beautiful views of nearby islands. It's considered an ideal spot for families seeking a peaceful retreat away from the busier beaches on Phuket's main island.

sources.snippet: What Ya Nui beach lacks in size, it more than makes up for in beauty. Just south of Nai Harn, it may only be 200m, but size isn‚Äôt everything. Rather than views of resorts, it features the view of nearby Koh Keyao Noi island and has dramatic rocky outcrops set alongside the cerulean sea that look ready-made for photographs.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Phuket, Thailand

sources.snippet: Now, if you would rather stick to Phuket's main island and prefer an even quieter beach than Nai Harn and Kamala, where you can go snorkeling and kayaking in solitude while watching the sunset, Ya Nui Beach on the west coast of Phuket, just south of Nai Harn, is the best place to be. Even though Ya Nui Beach is a very small beach, the smallest on this list, in fact, and it doesn't look particularly attractive, the beach is actually one of the most beautiful places to go kayaking at sunset. There are also a few resorts you can stay at, like Ya Nui Resort.
sources.shortName: Phuket‚Äôs Prettiest Beaches: My Top 8 Picks

sources.snippet: Located in the South of Phuket, Ya Nui is a popular favourite if you are searching for a smaller and quieter beach to common touristic ones like Nai Harn. Tucked secretly between the Windmill Viewpoint and Promthep Cape, Ya Nui beach is perfect for both beach dives and snorkelling with it‚Äôs crystal clear waters and relaxed atmosphere. You can also catch the sunset over the magnificent Promthep Cape from this beach which is something not to be missed.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Phuket You Can‚Äôt Miss

sources.snippet: One of the liveliest with compatible backgrounds representing Southeast Asia‚Äôs balmy climate is Ya Nui Beach. Small in scale but great in property, visiting Ya Nui has finally become a rising trend among Thais and foreign vacationers alike. Located at the foot of Windmill Viewpoint with its left side adjacent to Promthep Cape, Ya Nui Beach sits in a sweet location that unintentionally provides a view of two prominent capes of Phuket all at once.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Phuket within a Drive

sources.snippet: There is tranquility amid the beach, rocks, and palm trees different from other beaches. The beach stretching out into the sea to the point where rocks are visible in a triangle that is a beautiful viewpoint for taking a picture. There is a group of people gathering together for small activities such as kayaking, jet-skiing, snorkeling, sunbathing, and also a very beautiful sunset viewpoint.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Phuket

sources.snippet: Ya Nui Beach is tiny but has the charm of small beaches tucked in a cove between the Windmill Viewpoint and the famous Promthep Cape south of Phuket Island. It looks like a secret beach, but it is not, and many people come to enjoy it, especially for snorkelling and even beach diving. It‚Äôs just easy to miss it if it was not for the number of cars parked along the road.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Phuket Beaches ‚õ±Ô∏è

sources.snippet: A tiny little place just south of Naiharn beach, Ya Nui has a few bungalows which were rebuilt following the 2004 tsunami which hit this little beach hard. I have never seen more than a few dozen people here but it has got more popular recently. There are a few small restaurants just over the small road and good snorkeling around the rocks in high season.
sources.shortName: Phuket Beaches - Yes, we have a lot of Beaches!

sources.snippet:
Yanui Beach is located in a small bay just to the south of Nai Harn Beach and
Promthep Cape on the southern tip of Phuket, a great spot for families
with small kids. Read why Yanui is such a popular beach. Whilst the beaches on the west coast of Phuket are the best,
there are also some lovely beaches located on the south east coast of
Phuket.
sources.shortName: Phuket Beaches | Guide to the Best Beaches in Phuket.

sources.snippet: Yanui Beach is the southernmost beach on Phuket; it is a tiny but gorgeous beach. It is divided in two by a small sandbar that goes out to a small island that is 20 meters out from the beach. Because it‚Äôs a beautiful beach, next to the road, and impossible to miss, combined whit it‚Äôs tiny, it‚Äôs almost always crowded, or so it feels anyway.
sources.shortName: Full list of Phuket's best beaches, find them here

sources.snippet: Image Credit:  Christophe95, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons. A beautiful, but tiny beach on Phuket island is Ya Nui Beach which is more like a small cove. Just like the popular Nai Harn Beach, Ya Nui Beach is where you get an enthralling view of Phromthep Cape which displays one of the best panoramic views of Phuket.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Very Best Beaches in Phuket

sources.snippet: Ya Nui is a tiny beach touched in a turquoise cove located between Windmill Viewpoint and Promthep Cape at the southern end of Phuket. It‚Äôs actually a hidden beach but in recent years has become popular. The beach has 2 tiny bays divided by a rock formation in the middle.
sources.shortName: ‚ñ∑ 20 Most Beautiful Beaches in Phuket üå¥

sources.snippet: This might be one of the prettiest Phuket beaches I have seen from above. It can be seen from the area around Promthep Cape and from the Windmill viewpoint. Seeing it from above is the best as it reveals different tones of water colors.
sources.shortName: Discovering the most beautiful Phuket beaches

sources.snippet: More a small cove than a beach, Ya Nui is a perfect beach for families. It's well sheltered (at the back), a palatable size, and one of the cleanest beaches on the island. Ya Nui also employs lifeguards.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Phuket | PlanetWare

places.name: ‡πçYanui Beach

reviews.text:
Ya Nui Beach is a charming cove located in the southern part of Phuket, Thailand. This small beach is celebrated for its picturesque scenery, featuring soft, powdery sand and clear, blue-green waters. Its natural beauty make it a favored spot for both relaxation and various water activities.

The beach's rocky areas and clear waters provide excellent conditions for snorkeling. One can explore vibrant marine life close to the shore, with snorkeling gear available for rent.

Visitors can rent kayaks and stand-up paddleboards. Paddling out to the nearby Koh Man island, situated roughly 700 meters offshore, is a popular activity when the sea is calm.

A couple of local restaurants are situated across the road from the beach, offering a variety of Thai dishes and refreshments.

Overall, Ya Nui Beach provides a serene and scenic environment, ideal for those seeking a more intimate beach experience with opportunities for adventure and relaxation alike.
A gorgeous beach which is fabulous for snorkelling with wonderful fish a couple of metres from the waters edge but the downside is the rubbish floating in the water which is so sad to see.

My visit to Yanui Beach in Phuket was a delightful escape from the island's busier spots.

Tucked between Windmill Viewpoint and Promthep Cape, this small, crescent-shaped cove offers soft golden sand and clear, turquoise waters perfect for a serene day out.

Arriving early via Bolt from Kata (15-minute ride, with 250-400 THB), the beach was tranquil, with hardly any crowds. Snorkeling around the northern headland and rocky promontory was fantastic, vibrant corals and fish abound, with gear rentals at 100 THB. Kayaking to Koh Man, a nearby island, was a highlight for just 100-150 THB/hour.

The beach's laid-back vibe, framed by lush hills, is ideal for families and couples. Two small restaurants across the road, like Royros, serve tasty Thai dishes (200 THB) and refreshing coconut drinks.

However, litter in the water was noticeable, and low tide exposes rocks, making swimming tricky. No sunbeds or umbrellas keep it unspoiled, but bring a towel for shade under trees. Parking is limited, so arrive early.

Despite minor drawbacks, Yanui's charm and proximity to stunning viewpoints make it a must-visit for a peaceful Phuket beach day.

places.generalDescription: Nestled between Karon and Kata beach on the beach road, Dino Park Mini Golf & Restaurant offers an exciting evening filled with adventure. The 18-hole golf course is adorned with prehistoric-themed obstacles, life-size dinosaur models, and a thrilling exploding volcano that captivates visitors every 30 minutes. This family-friendly attraction also features a restaurant and bar designed with the famous cartoon Flintstone theme.

sources.snippet: As well as the incredible views, have fun at the Dino Park Mini Golf the kids and adults alike will just love, the Surf House where surfers can ride the waves every day no matter what the weather, and Kata Temple ‚Äì just 1km from the beach ‚Äì where you can bask in the beautiful culture of the island.
sources.shortName: 10 Reasons to visit Kata Beach in Phuket

sources.snippet: Dino Park Mini Golf Located between Kata and Karon, this quirky family-friendly mini-golf course is set in a prehistoric jungle with life-sized dinosaur sculptures and fun nighttime lighting.
sources.siteName: Phuket Travel Guide | Discover the best things to do in Phuket
sources.shortName: Kata Beach Phuket ‚Äì A Perfect Blend of Relaxation and Adventure

sources.snippet: Dino Park is a well-designed dinosaur-themed mini-golf with its cool volcano!. It is well-designed, and it‚Äôs great fun to play with friends or family, but it can get hot in there.
sources.shortName: Kata Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è How To Make The Best Of Your Stay In Kata?

sources.snippet: There is also a Buddhist Temple (Wat Kittisangkaram) on Patak Road, then you have Dino Park (Kids favourite) on the road to karon.
sources.shortName: Kata Beach | Phuket Travel Guide

places.name: Dino Park Mini Golf & Restaurant

reviews.text: We loved this place and would certainly recommend going with children. Playing miniature golf with dinosaurs around had been great fun. It didn't feel like the middle of a busy street and the animated dinosaurs were well done. Some of them need a bit of maintenance but still good.

Came here years ago as a kid and have fond memories of doing mini golf amongst dinosaurs! It was just as fun going as adults and the staff were very attentive, with them even coming out to provide umbrellas when it started to drizzle. The 18 holes are all very creative, fun for a one to two hour stop in Karon. We also got a nice drink after at the bar.

We travelled an hour or so to get to the park and we went there in the evening. We all had a fantastic time in the park. The scenery was great and we all had so much fun. All the holes were interesting and there was so much to see as we went round. We loved that the dinosaurs moved and we were so surprised when the volcano exploded.
We had food and drinks in the restaurant afterwards. The restaurant also had great scenery and the staff were very attentive. Pretty much hotel prices which I expected. My daughter had the chicken and fries, a huge portion of chicken that looked delicious but was quite dry. The burger was great but the fries were overcooked and burnt. The staff were great and quickly moved us inside when it started to rain. Probably wouldn't eat there again but would stop for drinks to enjoy the ambience after the golf.

places.address: 47 Karon Rd, Karon, Muang, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: The Sundeck is a trendy rooftop bar and restaurant located in Phuket, offering stunning views high above Kata Noi Beach. Opened in 2019, it provides a stylish and modern atmosphere to enjoy Mediterranean-inspired cuisine and the 'island's best sangrias.' Whether you visit for a daytime drink with a view or vibrant evening lounge vibes, The Sundeck offers an amazing ocean view and live DJs on weekends.

sources.snippet: The Sundeck Phuket is a superb cozy rooftop bar and restaurant in a fantastic location, high above the beautiful Kata Noi Beach. The location by the roadside between Kata Beach and Nai Harn Beach is such that almost everyone drives in front of this stunning viewpoint at least once
sources.shortName: Kata Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è How To Make The Best Of Your Stay In Kata?

sources.snippet: The Sundeck Phuket will be the first hillside chic restaurant on the right side of the road. In fact, with its trendy style it is inevitable not to see it. It serves an inspired Mediterranean cuisine accompanied by good wines.
sources.shortName: ‚ñ∑ Kata Noi Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è in Phuket ‚úÖ

places.name: The Sundeck

reviews.text: Came for the sunset, stayed for the vibes. Had a lovely meal and cocktails. Staff were great and attentive. Really enjoyed the experience. Will recommend. Book early for a great spot with great views.

**A great spot for dinner at sunset.**
The view is beautiful and the atmosphere is relaxing. It's a nice place to unwind and enjoy the scenery.

The only downside, which does make quite a difference, is the lack of fansüòÖ(!?), which can make it a bit uncomfortable on warmer evenings.

The food is okay, portions aren't very large, but it's definitely worth it for a sunset dinner.

The food was really good, we ordered pizza, wagyu burger, and Caesar salad.
The view is stunning, especially during sunset, and the place is calm and relaxing. Perfect spot to enjoy delicious food with a breathtaking sunset view.

places.address: 228 Koktanod Rd, Karon, Amphoe Mueang, Phuket 83000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Kata Noi Beach, a hidden gem on Phuket's southwest coast, offers an idyllic escape with its stunning white sands and crystal-clear aquamarine waters. Nestled in a serene bay just south of the bustling Karon Beach, this beach is perfect for families seeking relaxation away from the party scene of Patong. The 1.5 km stretch is lined with swaying palm trees that provide shade while vendors offer refreshing drinks and local snacks right at your fingertips.

sources.snippet: While it may only be 700m long, Kata Noi packs a whole world of charm onto such a small strip of beach. Located to the south of the larger, more popular Kata Beach, it‚Äôs much quieter than its neighbour and, whilst still fairly developed, has more of that private island feel. With a couple of fancy resorts and restaurants nearby, it‚Äôs perfect for day trips to the beach, and the sea here is ideal for activities such as snorkelling and surfing.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Phuket, Thailand

sources.snippet: As the name may suggest, Kata Noi, or ‚Äúlittle Kata Beach‚Äù, is the neighbor to Kata Beach which we discussed earlier. While it‚Äôs one of the smallest beaches on our list, Kata Noi is hands down one of the best, if not the absolute best beach in Phuket, in terms of the sand, the sea, the facilities including restaurants and few hotels, the surfing and snorkeling opportunities, etc. Unlike its big brother just around the corner to the north, Kata Noi also boasts an atmosphere that is noticeably peaceful and relaxing for most of the day.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Phuket within a Drive

sources.snippet: You can get yourself a sun lounger but there is little else ‚Äì beach vendors certainly don‚Äôt bother with Kata Noi. Surfers enjoy the northern end of the bay but surfing is more of a challenge in monsoon season when the water gets rough. There are no restaurants or bars on the beach itself, but those built on the hills behind offer fantastic views of the region as a whole.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches in Phuket

sources.snippet: Kata Noi Beach is a small bay located just 500 metres south of Kata Beach, separated by a short headland. The sand is even softer and whiter, and the sea is clear with a gentle slope, ideal for swimming during the dry season, and great for surfing in low season. Compared to the larger and busier Kata Beach, Kata Noi offers a quieter and more laid-back atmosphere.
sources.shortName: Kata Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è How To Make The Best Of Your Stay In Kata?

sources.snippet: With a peaceful pace that appeals to both active travelers and those looking to unwind, Kata Beach feels like a compact resort town with everything you need‚Äîcomfortable hotels, great food, shops, and plenty to explore both on the beach and off. Whether you‚Äôre seeking your next snorkeling spot, sunset stroll, or delicious Thai meal, Kata delivers on all fronts.
sources.siteName: Phuket Travel Guide | Discover the best things to do in Phuket
sources.shortName: Kata Beach Phuket ‚Äì A Perfect Blend of Relaxation and Adventure

sources.snippet: The bay is very picturesque with Koh Pu (Pu Island) at the northern end. Half of the beach is bordered by a road, while the southern half has a few resorts right on the beach. Club Med occupies a large portion of the land behind the beach road towards the northern end of the beach, keeping that end of the beach fairly quiet.
sources.shortName: Kata Beach Phuket - Beaches and Places

sources.snippet: Located south of Kata Beach, Kata Noi Beach (means Little Kata) is one of Phuket best beaches. Kata Noi Beach is like miniature Kata - same white sand, same beautiful blue water, but the beach is smaller and more intimate. The beach is still not commercialized, so there are only a handful of sun loungers to sunbathe.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Phuket, Thailand: 15 Most Beautiful Beaches

sources.snippet: Kata Noi Beach is a much quieter and relaxed alternative to the main Kata Beach. Located just slightly further on from Kata Beach, Kata Noi Beach is situated in a small cove with crystal blue waters; white sand and waves ideal for surfing - a perfect beach location you can‚Äôt miss.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Phuket You Can‚Äôt Miss

sources.snippet: Kata Noi Beach with its white sand and incredibly clear waters especially in high season, ranks as one of the most beautiful beaches in Phuket. The beach remains quiet and not busy despite is located just next to the popular Kata Beach because it remains hidden from the main road!
sources.shortName: ‚ñ∑ Kata Noi Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è in Phuket ‚úÖ

sources.snippet: In 2016, Tripadvisor ranked Kata Noi Beach as the best beach in Thailand, three in Asia, and 19 worldwide. It is a small, lovely beach with powdery white soft sand and crystal clear blue water. But I wouldn‚Äôt rank it as the number one beach in Thailand.
sources.shortName: Full list of Phuket's best beaches, find them here

sources.snippet: Next and the last beach for me this day was Kata Noi beach, a beach 10 min walk away from Kata beach. Kata Noi is way smaller than Kata beach but I found it more charming. There were a lot of surfers there although there weren‚Äôt those many waves.
sources.shortName: Discovering the most beautiful Phuket beaches

sources.snippet: Beside the famous Kata Beach lies a hidden gem ‚Äì Kata Noi Beach. Unless you know about it, you‚Äôll probably miss it!. Too bad because this beach was once voted by TripAdvisor as one of the ten most beautiful beaches in the world!
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Phuket Beaches You'll Love in 2025

sources.snippet:
Kata Noi is a much smaller bay, with lush green covered mountains. There is a few
shops, hotels and restaurants and is a great spot ideal if travelling
with kids. Read more about Kata Noi.
sources.shortName: Phuket Beaches | Guide to the Best Beaches in Phuket.

sources.snippet: Just a few minutes drive from Kata Beach, it's home to the Kata Thani Resort and Mom Tri's Villa Royale, yet retains a quiet feeling, mainly I think because the road goes nowhere!
sources.shortName: Phuket Beaches - Yes, we have a lot of Beaches!

places.name: Kata Noi Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful beach ‚õ±Ô∏è  there where no swimming signs and it was choppy but it seems quite safe if you stay close. Not too crowded and very clean! Would 100% recommend

It is a quiet enough beach, without a lot of entertainment venues. Most often people come to this beach, stay in a hotel and try not to go far away, enjoying a quiet vacation.

The beach is small in size: its length is about 700 meters. In high season there are a lot of tourists here, but compared to the previous beaches: Kata and Karon, there is a place to stay!

Kata Noi beach is quite a famous vacation spot among tourists.

The flora here is made up of trees of mixed species, nevertheless, the beach is open enough to spread the sun's rays. Be sure to use high UV protection creams when sunbathing here.

The sand here is soft, light gray in color. The entrance to the sea is medium deep. The water is clear, blue-green color! The wind in the high season is not strong.

The bulk of vacationing tourists are concentrated at the hotels adjacent to the beach.

Full information with video and easy navigation - in the app üëâ PHUKETON

Kata Noi Beach is a stunning, quiet escape with soft golden sand and crystal-clear water. Less crowded than nearby beaches, it's perfect for swimming, sunbathing, or catching a breathtaking sunset.

Staying at Katathani Phuket Beach Resort makes the experience even better, with direct beachfront access, lush pools, and seaside dining. While the area has limited nightlife, it's ideal for a relaxing getaway.

‚úîÔ∏è Beautiful, clean, and quiet
‚úîÔ∏è Great swimming & incredible sunsets
‚úîÔ∏è Best enjoyed from Katathani Resort

‚ùå Few dining options nearby but couple very good options (BlueShark)
‚ùå Can be wavy in monsoon season when the waves/swell are coming from the west.

‚≠ê 5/5 ‚Äì Perfect for those seeking tranquility!

places.address: Karon, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Kata Beach Viewpoint, formerly known as Kata Viewpoint, offers one of the most famous panoramas in Phuket. From this vantage point, visitors can enjoy breathtaking views of three magnificent bays: Kata Noi Beach, Kata Beach with its island Koh Poo, and Karon Beach. It is recommended to visit this spot when visiting the Big Buddha as it provides an unparalleled view and also offers delicious food and outstanding service.

sources.snippet: Like the Kata/Karon viewpoint, which is one of the most frequented viewpoints in Phuket, and it‚Äôs no wonder considering from the top you can soak in views of Kata Noi, Kata Yai and Karon Beaches, which is why it‚Äôs locally known as ‚ÄúSaam-haad‚Äù (three-beach) viewpoint.
sources.shortName: 10 Reasons to visit Kata Beach in Phuket

sources.snippet: On the hill under the beach is a Kata Viewpoint where people can see impressive views on the shore and sea.
sources.shortName: Kata Beach, Phuket

places.name: Kata Beach Viewpoint

reviews.text:
Best scenery in Phuket!!
Good view of the big buddah as well
beautiful scenery overlooking kata and karon beach üèùÔ∏è

If you're visiting the Big Buddha, this is a must-visit restaurant, even if you're not hungry and you just want to grab a drink. You won't find a better view around, but we're that not enough, the food is absolutely delicious and the service is outstanding. This was one of our premier dining experiences in Phuket, even though it's simple fare, and I can't recommend it enough. To get here, just take a 5-minute walk down the hill from the Big Buddha and you'll be there in no time.

places.address: R8J5+4VW, Karon, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nui Beach, also known as Water Beach Club or Rock Swing Beach, is a secluded paradise located on the west coast of Phuket. Accessible through a coconut grove after Karon Viewpoint, this undeveloped sandy beach offers a peaceful holiday experience away from the tourist crowds. With limited facilities and fewer visitors compared to neighboring beaches, Nui Beach provides an unspoiled and tranquil environment for relaxation.

sources.snippet: Nui Beach is one of the beaches that I rank higher than Kata Noi beach. It‚Äôs a charming little beach and probably one of Phuket‚Äôs most hidden and secret beaches, and one of the beaches at the top of the list of Phuket‚Äôs best beaches. It is a hidden secret beach, mainly because it is one of the most challenging beaches to get to.
sources.shortName: Full list of Phuket's best beaches, find them here

sources.snippet: Hidden in the greenery of south Phuket‚Äôs jungle, Nui Beach is tucked away from the island‚Äôs typically rowdy atmosphere. This secret beach, as some call it, is much quieter and one of the prettiest beaches in Phuket. Nui Beach is a small, 120-meter stretch of sand surrounded by palm trees and large rocks dotting the landscape.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Phuket Beaches You'll Love in 2025

places.name: Nui Beach

reviews.text:
For anyone seeking a breathtaking, secluded beach with crystal-clear waters, Nui Beach is an absolute dream. The journey? A fun off-road adventure that only adds to the experience-unless, of course, you believe every paradise should come with a four-lane highway.

Now, let's clear up some misunderstandings: Nui Beach, like all beaches in Thailand, is part of the kingdom's natural beauty and is open to everyone. You're free to enjoy the sand and sea at no cost. However, the sunbeds, bar, and other facilities are privately maintained, and naturally, access to these comforts comes with a fee-just as you'd expect anywhere that provides quality service in a beautiful setting.

Some visitors seem surprised that a remote beach club isn't running as a charity, but for those who appreciate a well-kept paradise and don't mind supporting the people who make it special, Nui Beach is more than worth it. If adventure, exclusivity, and stunning scenery sound like your kind of day, you'll love it here as much as we did!

And a special mention: the owner's replies to brainrotted reviews are truly a gem of their own -some of the best communication I've seen, pure and honest. That alone makes this appreciation review worth writing. Recommended ü•∞

(If you disagree; get yourself checked, mentally.)

The beach itself is very cool...however be warned that the road to access it is not really a road but more of an off-road trail.  It's actually part of an ATV park.  I did make it on a scooter, so it is possible on a scooter or motorcycle, however I would not recommend this for a novice rider.  The terrain is very steep with lots of rocks and washouts.  Also be warned they have started collecting a fee to visit and a little man literally sprinted to me with his hand out to collect the 100 baht fee before I could even park and get off my bike.  They then added a 20 baht "parking" fee.  The whole thing was very scam-y.  In the big picture the fee and risk of personal injury is probably worth it to access the beach.  The whole place has a very pirate vibe with several bars and great picture points.  They have spent lots of time and energy to decorate it very well.  Overall...worth it...if you are aware of the risk and cost!

Quite the experience. Nui beach is a hidden gem. Whilst close to the busy Kata, you feel like in an other peaceful world. Far from the crowds, amazing views, crystal clear water, and lots of beautiful fishes if you fancy an improvised snorkeling session. The way to the beach is very steep and bumpy. So you might want to hike there (or drive you scooter if you have good suspensions). Also, locals provide 4x4 taxi and ATV services. The journey through the jungle is worth it.

places.address: Soi Laemmumnok, Karon, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the serene Kata Noi, Mom Tri's Villa Royale offers an exclusive royal experience as it was once a residence of the Royal family of Thailand. This upscale all-suite hotel boasts refined dining options, two bars, and three outdoor pools with stunning ocean views. Guests can enjoy a peaceful atmosphere and a delightful breakfast. The beautifully appointed rooms provide breathtaking views, while the beach nearby offers an unforgettable workout experience.

sources.snippet: Mom Tri‚Äôs Villa Royale has unique features and has been renowned for decades, built on the hillside of Kata Noi‚Äôs northern end. This unusual hotel, surrounded by a beautiful garden, used to be a private house converted very successfully into a hotel. Each room of the original wing has its unique design and decoration; one still features its wine cellar built into a rock boulder.
sources.shortName: Kata Noi Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è How To Make The Best Of Your Stay?

places.name: Mom Tri's Villa Royale

reviews.text: Absolutely sublime. Such a perfect oasis amidst the business of the resorts in Phuket. Close enough to walk to restaurants and beaches at Kata Noi and Kata. Food was exceptional and the staff very attentive. Highly recommended.

Started as beautiful holidays and ended in discussions with the staff. We've been charged for water which was declared as free drinking water. 10 euros for 400 ml water. Would not recommend. Room was nice, except dripping water from the ceiling, which was most propably the Air Condition. Problem was fixed quickly though. Hotel is on a hill, prepare for a lot of walking/climbing. Nice view over the beach and sea.
Beautiful, large rooms in an even more beautiful scenery. Also the staff was outstanding during our stay. Highly recommending a cocktail during happy hour to watch the sunset.

places.address: 12 Kata Noi Rd, Tambon Karon, Kata, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Ra Wai Beach, located at the southern end of Phuket island, is renowned as the first tourist beach on the island. While not suitable for swimming, it offers stunning views of nearby islands and a tranquil local atmosphere. The beach serves as a departure point for boat tours to various islands and sightseeing spots in the surrounding sea. Visitors can enjoy fresh seafood at nearby restaurants and explore the local fishing community.

sources.snippet: How abundant Thai marine life is can be witnessed yourself at Rawai Beach, a seafood culinary destination for those on the lookout of the most mouth-watering seafood dishes in Phuket. Whether by search or through the mouths of locals, Rawai has always on top of the list. A seaside lined seafood restaurants and local fresh seafood stalls are expecting you in Rawai.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Phuket within a Drive

sources.snippet: This is not the beach where you go to lay in the sun and bath on the sea. The beach is filled with all types of boats and is basically where you should go to rent a longtail boat to visit nearby islands such as CORAL ISLAND. The beach is beautiful with amazing blue waters and has some waterfront restaurants that looked very appealing.
sources.shortName: Discovering the most beautiful Phuket beaches

sources.snippet: At the south end of Phuket Island, Rawai is not a swimming beach but offers beautiful views of the nearby islands. It is an anchoring point for the many longtail boats and speedboats going to Racha Island or Coral Island. It‚Äôs a great place to enjoy fresh seafood and a good starting point for island hopping.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Phuket Beaches ‚õ±Ô∏è

sources.snippet: We were looking for lunch and fresh juice when we stumbled upon Rawai Beach after we visited the Big Buddha and Promthep Cape. We had to stop our motorbike when we saw its Maldives-like view. Although not suitable for swimming, Rawai Beach provides a peaceful escape from the usual tourist crowds.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Phuket Beaches You'll Love in 2025

sources.snippet: Close to Chalong Bay and Naiharn beach, Rawai is full of small restaurants and food stalls and is a great place to rent a longtail boat to nearby islands. Not a swimming beach really, but makes a good stop off on a tour of the southwest corner of Phuket.
sources.shortName: Phuket Beaches - Yes, we have a lot of Beaches!

sources.snippet: It is not suitable for swimming but the view is very beautiful. This beach is recommended for seafood which is tasty and inexpensive. Also, you can walk to see the fisherman's way of life or buy cute souvenirs on the seaside.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Phuket

places.name: Ra Wai Beach

reviews.text:
The beach is full of docked boats, making it unsuitable for sunbathing or swimming, but it provides a different kind of vibe.

I enjoy observing the numerous small animals without needing to dive.

The place is practically empty, tranquil, and serene. It's easily accessible; just park and enjoy a walk.

Surrounding environment is suitable for just sightseeing the vibe over there.  I wouldn't recommend for swimming or playing sand at here as you can see from the pictures there are a lot of boats and the nearly no place to walk nearby the ocean
Great for dining, walking and getting the vibe. Not suitable for a perfect sun and sand experience. Mainly boats with less space to swim or enjoy the nature.

places.generalDescription: Boathouse Restaurant in Cherngtalay offers a unique dining experience with a blend of traditional Thai dishes and international flavors. The menu features creative dishes like Foie Gras Bites Thai Style, Tuna Tartar in Thai Style, Sea Bass Steak, Rice Berry Risotto, Coconut Prawn and Green Curry Sauce. The restaurant's interior design provides an intimate ambiance with indoor and outdoor dining areas, a counter bar, and BBQ terrace.

sources.snippet: Kata Noi Beach is adjacent to Kata Beach to the south, so keep going straight after the well-known The Boathouse in Kata Beach and the road will eventually rise and will continue uphill. Please keep right till reach the prestigious Katathani Phuket Beach Resort. Instead, driving downhill from Karon Viewpoint, just 100 meters after the SIS Kata Resort, turn left and continue till the end of the road.
sources.shortName: ‚ñ∑ Kata Noi Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è in Phuket ‚úÖ

sources.snippet: The Boathouse Phuket is one of just two hotels in Kata with direct beachfront access. This small, boutique hotel has 39 stylish rooms and suites, many with sea views and private balconies. The highlight is the Boathouse Restaurant, right above the beach, serving excellent Southern Thai and international dishes with views over the bay.
sources.shortName: Kata Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è How To Make The Best Of Your Stay In Kata?

places.name: The Boathouse Restaurant

reviews.text:
I recently had lunch at Boathouse and it was an incredible experience. The food was absolutely delicious, everything was cooked to perfection.

Chef Jonathan was so friendly and engaging, making the entire lunch experience feel so special.

The service was also excellent, with the staff being attentive and courteous.

If you're looking for a good atmosphere, lunch by the beach, I highly recommend. Thank you for incredible experience.

There really are no words to describe the level of service we received here tonight. Daniele you and your staff are an absolute credit to this place. We can not wait to stay here on our next visit and will certainly be telling our Australian friends about you. Food was outstanding. Please visit. You will not regret it. Photos don't do this place justice.

Had a lovely meal at The Boathouse. The restaurant is right on the beach with beautiful views, making it a perfect spot to relax and enjoy the setting.

The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, and the food was good across the board. Everything was nicely presented and full of flavour.

Must have: The massaman curry. Rich, comforting and really well done.

Great place for a beachfront meal with a relaxed vibe. Would definitely come back

places.address: Karon, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Previously Surf House, located near Kata Beach in Phuket, was a popular spot for surfers of all levels. Whether you were a beginner or an expert, the thrill of riding the waves and enjoying the afterparty with locals made it an unforgettable experience. The venue offered great food and drinks, with shower stations available for cleaning up after a day at the beach. Additionally, they provided surfing lessons and even hosted free ladies' surf sessions.

sources.snippet: As well as the incredible views, have fun at the Dino Park Mini Golf the kids and adults alike will just love, the Surf House where surfers can ride the waves every day no matter what the weather, and Kata Temple ‚Äì just 1km from the beach ‚Äì where you can bask in the beautiful culture of the island.
sources.shortName: 10 Reasons to visit Kata Beach in Phuket

sources.snippet: Surf House Phuket On the southern end of the beach road is a permanent wave machine offering endless surfing action. It‚Äôs perfect for beginners, and the adjacent bar and restaurant make it a fun spot to hang out, especially during sunset.
sources.siteName: Phuket Travel Guide | Discover the best things to do in Phuket
sources.shortName: Kata Beach Phuket ‚Äì A Perfect Blend of Relaxation and Adventure

places.name: Surf House Phuket

reviews.text: First time doing a surf, and all I could say is that it was such a fun experience for me. The price was quite high for locals, but it's alright for this activity. Also, had a bottle of wine with my friend while we waited for our turns to do the surfing. There was also live music which I'm not a huge fan of. Overall, it was such a great time

Amazing location just off the beach with great food, drinks and surfing lessons.
We stayed here for a while and ordered one of the huge pizzas and a Chang tower.
It had a great atmosphere and the staff were lovely.

DO NOT GO HERE.

We came as a family excited for the experience. I have two young boys 6 & 8 and the man at the desk gladly took my money $100 for both without asking any questions about previous experience. Safety briefing etc

The team barely briefed the boys with what to do and within 5 seconds of starting one of my sons got really upset and didn't want to continue after being washed off the board.

I asked the man at front if my husband could take his a spot (literally 5 seconds after the session started) so he could support my 6 yr old as he was now alone and he refused. The men facilitating the session were absolutely no help either offering suggestions on how younger people could manage the fast waves.

So I paid $100 for literally nothing. No refunds, no exceptions, overall a horrible customer experience and a
money making scam if you have young kids avoid this place.

Places like this need better management. My kids left feeling ripped off. Could have been a magic experience if guided better. Or guided at all. AVOID

places.address: 4 Soi Pakbang, Karon, A.Muang, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Kata Rocks is a luxurious resort in Phuket, offering upscale villas with private pools, dining options, and beach access. The resort hosts the island's best pool brunch every Saturday, featuring delicious cocktails and live DJ music. Guests can enjoy succulent cuisine including seafood, fine meats, appetizers, salads, cheeses, and desserts alongside signature cocktails and fine wines.

sources.snippet: The resort sits on a hillside near Kata Beach, with 34 massive Sky Villas, each with a private infinity pool and superb views of the sea. The villas are bright, modern, and packed with fun gadgets. We really liked the restaurant by the pool, especially at sunset.
sources.shortName: Kata Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è How To Make The Best Of Your Stay In Kata?

places.name: Kata Rocks

reviews.text: Kata Rocks is an absolutely stunning place. The view from the pool overlooking the ocean is breathtaking, especially at sunset-it was truly magical. The food was incredible, full of flavor and beautifully presented. The staff was exceptionally friendly and made the experience even better. We will definitely return on our next trip to Thailand. Highly recommended!

Our experience at Kata Rocks was deeply disappointing. We stayed in Villa 501, located next to the forest, and unfortunately, the pool and surrounding area were consistently unclean. The morning breakfast buffet was underwhelming and far below expectations.

That said, the √† la carte menu was quite good, and the views from the resort are undeniably stunning.

However, guests should be aware that the resort enforces a strict cancellation policy. We were charged the full amount for an unused night, despite providing valid reasons and supporting documentation for our early departure. The management's lack of flexibility and understanding was very disheartening.

Kara Rocks is absolutely amazing. I think most people already know how luxurious and beautiful the location is. While it can be a little challenging to get there with your own vehicle-since it's located on top of a hill-it's definitely worth the effort.

Once you arrive, you can enjoy the restaurant and bar, which offer a great selection of food prepared by skilled chefs. The best time to go is around 5 to 6 PM, so you can catch the stunning sunset over Kata Beach while you dine or have a drink. It's truly a perfect spot for a special evening.

places.address: 186/22 Kok Tanode Road, Kata Rd, Mueng, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: After Beach Bar & Restaurant, a well-established establishment in Phuket, boasts stunning sea and beach views. Its modest appearance with low thatched roofs and wooden terraces on stilts against the hill may seem unassuming at first, but it becomes a hotspot for tourists seeking the best beach scenery at night. The reggae-themed restaurant offers a spacious deck for patrons to enjoy breathtaking sunset views over Kata Noi Beach.

sources.snippet: After Beach Bar and Baan Chom View are 2 popular restaurants with stunning sea view, built on wooden stilts. Seen both from outside, they seem modest with their strange dark entrances, but be aware that, they are there more than 2 decades. Once you arrive at their terraces, you will admire an extraordinary panoramic view over the whole blue bay of Kata Noi.
sources.shortName: ‚ñ∑ Kata Noi Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è in Phuket ‚úÖ

sources.snippet: After Beach Bar was one of the first panoramic bars above Kata Noi Beach, it started as a Reggae bar with a Bob Marley theme, and while the Rasta colours are still displayed on the facade and inside of the restaurant, it‚Äôs a lot toned down now.
sources.shortName: Kata Noi Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è How To Make The Best Of Your Stay?

places.name: After Beach Bar & Restaurant

reviews.text: Food was lovely, very tasty.  We had a beautiful whole fish and presentation and taste was great.  Staff extremely friendly and efficient. Fantastic view and atmosphere

This is one of restaurants that you should visit. It is a very nice restaurant and cafe with so beautiful views of the Adaman sea. They have various choices of seafood and Thai local foods. The food price is reasonable and tourism price. I recommend you to stop at here for a short time. The staff are so friendly and kind. Their service is impressive and fast.

Phenomenal! Cannot recommend enough, for me the meal I just had there was perfect. Service was spot on, food was lovely and the setting is amazing! The Bob Marley theme stops at the music and decor unfortunately but there's a bar across the road and up a hill you can blaze afterwards. Perfect

places.address: 44 Kata Rd, Karon, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Starbucks is a well-known coffeehouse chain originating from Seattle, offering its signature roasts and light bites along with WiFi access. The spacious store provides ample indoor and outdoor seating as well as convenient parking. Visitors can collect city mugs from various locations in Thailand at this location. It's a great spot to enjoy familiar comforts while traveling, providing a quiet and clean workspace away from home.

sources.snippet: Places you may want to visit, Full Moon Pizzeria, Il tagliere Da Massimo, La Gondola, The Coffee Pot, Ban Thai, Dino Park and Dino Bar, Kampong Kata Hill Restaurant, On The Rocks at Marina Cottage, Sorrento, Starbucks, Two Chefs in Kata, Mom tri's Kitchen, Oasis by the Sea, Tomato Restaurant, Buffalo Steakhouse Kata, Capannina Italian Restaurant, Mali Restaurant, and so on, and so on...
sources.shortName: Kata Beach | Phuket Travel Guide

places.name: Starbucks

reviews.text: The place is in a good location not far from the beach. Plenty of seating inside and the air conditioning felt so nice coming from the outside. Coffee is just like any other Starbucks but you don't really come here looking for specialty coffee. Service was good and the staff tries their best to communicate with customers considering that the clientele comes from all over the world. A solid spot if you are just looking for US style coffee in a familiar setting.

A great location Starbucks near hotels, the beach and off one of the main roads near everything. The service is very friendly, it has all of the Thailand mugs merchandise and amazing air conditioning! Of course wifi is here too and there is an indoor and outdoor section.

I have been very pleased with the Starbucks service and quality of drinks in Thailand and this location did not disappoint me!
Cappuccino is good. Air cond is great. Nothing more))))

places.address: Kata Center, 4 Taina Rd, Karon, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83100, Thailand
